cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 180 (Wednesday, November 1, 2023)][House][Pages H5229-H5230]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DUARTE:H.R. 6139.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:[[Page H5230]]Article I, Section 8, Clause 7 of the U.S. Constitutiongives Congress the authority to establish new post officesThe single subject of this legislation is:Establishing a new post office.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

bill.title: To direct the Postal Service to establish a post office at 73 West Stewart Road in Lathrop, California, and for other purposes.

item.title: To direct the Postal Service to establish a post office at 73 West Stewart Road in Lathrop, California, and for other purposes.
To direct the Postal Service to establish a post office at 73 West Stewart Road in Lathrop, California, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
